articles.content: The one thing scientists will be hanging on the edge of their seats for when Artemis 3 touches lunar soil is evidence of life on the Moon. But considering how our Moon's bleak and barren-looking topo… [+2117 chars]

articles.title: Cracking the Code: How NASA Names Mars' Craters, Rocks, and Everything In-Between! | Explained - Times Now
articles.description: Take a fascinating dive into the intriguing methods and history behind NASA's Mars naming conventions, from official monikers approved by the International Astronomical Union to the more whimsical, unofficial nicknames.
